    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Erases all vertex data from this VertexArray and puts it in a state as though it was just instantiated.

      • burn

        public java.nio.FloatBuffer burn()
        Burns the vertex data to a FloatBuffer and then clears the VertexArray. The FloatBuffer is flipped before being returned to the caller. You cannot burn an empty VertexArray (i.e. when getSize() returns 0). Doing so triggers a MemoryException. Since burning implicitly clears the VertexArray, this means you cannot burn a VertexArray twice without adding some vertex data in between.
        Returns:
        A FloatBuffer containing all vertices added to this VertexArray
        Throws:
        MemoryException - If the VertexArray is empty.
        See Also:
        clear()

        public RawMemory xyzw(float x,
                      float y,
                      float z)

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Get the total size of all vertices stored in this VertexArray (i.e. the number of elements occupied by the vertices in the internally maintained raw float array).

      • available

        public int available()
        Get the remaining capacity of this VertexArray (i.e. the number of elements still unused in the internally maintained float array).
        Returns:
